snippet: The agreement between the de Blasio administration and the teachers’ and principals’ unions came just before a deadline for the city to submit plans to the state for turning around the institutions.
abstract: De Blasio administration says it will require entire staff at Boys and Girls High School in Bedford-Stuyvesant and Automotive High School in Greenpoint to reapply for their jobs in 2015; move is result of deal with teachers' and principals' union that came just before state deadline; schools are two of New York City's lowest performing schools, and require extensive changes.
lead_paragraph: The agreement between the de Blasio administration and the teachers’ and principals’ unions came just before a deadline for the city to submit plans to the state for turning around the institutions.

headline.main: With Deal, Staff at 2 Struggling Schools in Brooklyn Must Reapply for Jobs
headline.print_headline: With Deal, Staff at Two Struggling Schools in Brooklyn Must Reapply for Jobs

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Boys and Girls High School (Brooklyn, NY)
